documentation.author: Cerner Model
documentation.purpose:
Rule fires when an admission order is placed on a Medicare Patient. As alert appears requiring the provider to complete a certification PowerForm satisfying the two-midnight rule.
The rule can be flexed to provider different defaults in the PowerForm for Behavioral Health and/or Critical Access Hospital patients.
When a Resident, Medical Student, Physician Assistant, or Nurse Practitioner places a PSO Admit to Inpatient order, a phone message will be sent to the attending physician that the order needs co-signature.
May be leveraged after review and removing/updating localized locations.
documentation.impact:
The Following templates require reinstantiation to localize content at client sites:
E1 - OPT_ORDERS should be populated with local orders that signify admission to inpatient care
L3 - POSITION should be populated with local positions who should not trigger this rule when ordering admission
L4 - DETAIL_VALUE should be populated with local values for financial class that signify Medicare
L5 - Inside the parenthesis, all applicable code_values for Medicare insurance on codeset 354 should be added and separated by commas
L9 - POSITION should be populated with local positions who should trigger this rule but not receive alerts to certify the inpatient stay when ordering admission
L10 - LIST1 should be populated with local values for order details that signify admission to behavioral health
L11 - DETAIL_VALUE should be populated with local locations that signify 'Critical Access Hospitals'
A1 - RECIPIENT should be populated with local relationships who should receive an inbox message to cosign admission orders. This relationship must be established prior to the admit order being entered.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ORDER_LIST_E
templateDefinitions.definition: an order ORD_METHOD OPT_ORDERS with status of OPT_ORDER_STATUS and an optional order detail of OPT_ORDER_DETAIL that OPT_QUALIFIER OPT_LIST

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_STOP_LOGIC_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the following templates are false, MODE logic evaluation
templateDefinitions.description: Used to control efficiency of Action Group rules

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ENCOUNTER_DETAIL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the patient's ENC_DETAIL QUAL DETAIL_VALUE for the same encounter as OPT_LINK

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CALC_SAVE_L
templateDefinitions.description: Create a value to be used by subsequent templates

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_NORMALCY_L
templateDefinitions.definition: The most recent result for EVENT_SET_NAME has a result status of STATUS and NORMALCY normalcy on the same encounter as OPT_LINK within the last OPT_TIME_NUM OPT_TIME_UNIT.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ORDER_LIST_INCOMING_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the triggering request contains an order ORD_METHOD OPT_ORDERS with status of OPT_ORDER_STATUS and an optional order detail of OPT_ORDER_DETAIL that OPT_QUALIFIER OPT_LIST

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_ENCOUNTER_LOC_DETAIL_L
templateDefinitions.definition: the patient's ENC_DETAIL that QUAL in DETAIL_VALUE for the same encounter as OPT_LINK

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_INBOX_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Send a MSG_TYPE related to PATIENT to the In-Box of RECIPIENT with SUBJECT and MSG with MSG_PRIORITY.

templateDefinitions.name: EKS_CE_CREATE_CODED_CE_A
templateDefinitions.definition: Create a STATUS, OPT_NORMALCY, EVENT_NAME result of VALUE1 OPT_UNITS_OF_MEASURE on the same encounter as LINK with OPT_COMMENT_TYPE of OPT_COMMENT and RESEND send this event back through Discern Expert. OPT_INHERIT_DYN_LABEL inherit the dynamic label, if one exisits.

values.value: PSO Admit to Inpatient Behavioral Health

value.value: SELECT HP.ACTIVE_IND FROM ENCNTR_PLAN_RELTN E, HEALTH_PLAN HP PLAN E WHERE E.ENCNTR_ID = @ENCOUNTERID:{patInfo} JOIN HP WHERE E.HEALTH_PLAN_ID = HP.HEALTH_PLAN_ID AND HP.FINANCIAL_CLASS_CD IN (634778.00,634777.00,634776.00)@NEWLINEDETAIL log_misc1 = "FOUND" go

values.value: PSO Admit to Inpatient Behavioral Health

value.value: Need Co-Signature on Patient Status Order
Please co-sign the Patient Status Order before this patient can be discharged.
